messages.message: I think minikube is the best option. One other option I had used in the past (when docker desktop didn't exist) was `docker-machine` (which internally used a linux VM) and all containers uses that VM by communicating to that VM via some ports. https://www.macadamian.com/learn/docker-machine-basic-examples/

another consideration: minikube requires a hypervisor, and without docker desktop, the most common choice is to use hyperkit, which isn’t supported yet on M1 https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/issues/11885
cc @Heymian since I remember you were looking into running Instabase on M1 laptops

some blog posts that walk through the transition
https://itnext.io/goodbye-docker-desktop-hello-minikube-3649f2a1c469
https://arnon.me/2021/09/replace-docker-with-minikube/
https://medium.com/rahasak/replace-docker-desktop-with-minikube-and-hyperkit-on-macos-783ce4fb39e3

We have a document that captures how to run instabase in minikube: https://docs.google.com/document/d/17VHHnZbH0JqDhLSUPSCiHNOgwbQCvJTU57D5MmtRUmk/edit
Two caveats:
[1] System overheats pretty quickly
[2] This guide does not cover recent of services: license service [@Naveen], control-plane [@kunal], and model-training-tasks [@arun/@lydia]
tldr — it would require a side project’s effort for these new services to be minikube compliant. Maybe they might work out of the box. :crossed_fingers:
hey @Mohit who can I work with to get model-training-tasks working with minikube for local dev?

@arun you will have to follow the steps in the document and replicate the same set of steps for model-training-tasks and resolve the issues if you encounter any. Happy to help. No one in particular owns minikube rn. @Ashish & I did this as part of a fun-challenge. (Ashish its _that_ evening in Sutter office with Tami’s table fan haha) :stuck_out_tongue:
I remember that evening and the fan! Let's make sure @Aaron Tami knows that we are talking about his fan. :joy:
